Can you help me to setup profitable campaign and how we optimize campaign on you?

Sure, I can help you with setting up a profitable campaign and optimizing it on NewsBreak. To get started, you can follow our Campaign Set-Up Guide which provides detailed instructions on how to create and manage your campaigns effectively. You can find the guide here: [Campaign Set-Up Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/29943576259469-Campaign-Set-Up-Guide). For optimization tips, you might want to check out our best practices articles such as tCPA Best Practices and Maximize Conversions Best Practices.
Do you also provide the offers should we try and tCPA that is already someone is achieving?

You can refer to our tCPA Best Practices guide for advanced strategies and recommendations to help you achieve the best results. You can find the guide here: [tCPA Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18020232662797-tCPA-Best-Practices).

This can help you optimize your campaigns effectively. You can find more details in our tCPA Best Practices guide here: [tCPA Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18020232662797-tCPA-Best-Practices).
I tried the netwrok before but there was no success I had so far

I'm sorry to hear that you haven't had success with the network so far. Let's see if we can improve your results. Here are a few tips to help optimize your campaigns on NewsBreak: 
1. **Increase Your Daily Budget**: Try increasing your daily budget by 20-30% every 2-3 days to give your campaigns more room to perform.
2. **Analyze Weekly Performance**: Instead of looking at daily performance, analyze your campaign performance on a weekly basis to identify trends and areas for improvement.
3. **Use the Bid Estimation Tool**: Utilize our bid estimation tool to identify ad sets with high growth potential and project conversion, cost, and impression metrics based on bid rate adjustments.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to our tCPA Best Practices guide here: [tCPA Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18020232662797-tCPA-Best-Practices).
If you need further assistance or have specific questions about your campaigns, feel free to reach out!
Do you suggest to run ads on landing pages that are focused on single product like shopify?

Yes, running ads on landing pages that are focused on a single product, like those on Shopify, can be very effective. Single-product landing pages tend to have higher conversion rates because they provide a clear and focused message to the user. Here are a few tips for optimizing such landing pages:
1. **Clear Call-to-Action (CTA)**: Make sure your CTA is prominent and easy to understand.
2. **High-Quality Images/Videos**: Use high-quality visuals to showcase your product effectively.
3. **Customer Reviews**: Include customer reviews or testimonials to build trust.
4. **Fast Loading Speed**: Ensure your landing page loads quickly to prevent users from bouncing.
5. **Mobile Optimization**: Make sure your landing page is optimized for mobile devices as many users will access it from their phones.
For more detailed guidance on creating effective ads and optimizing them, you can refer to our Campaign Set-Up Guide here: [Campaign Set-Up Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/29943576259469-Campaign-Set-Up-Guide).

For a new campaign what you think what bid strategy should I use, and how can I save waste spend on you I am small advertiser with limited budget

For a new campaign, I recommend starting with the tCPA (target Cost Per Action) bid strategy. This strategy allows you to set a predefined cost goal, ensuring that your campaigns remain cost-effective and focused on acquiring results. Here are some tips to help you save on ad spend and optimize your budget:
1. **Set Clear Goals**: Define what actions you want users to take (e.g., purchases, sign-ups) and set your tCPA accordingly.
2. **Start with a Small Budget**: Begin with a smaller daily budget and gradually increase it based on performance.
3. **Monitor Performance Regularly**: Keep an eye on your campaign's performance metrics and make adjustments as needed.
4. **Use High-Quality Creatives**: Ensure your ad creatives are engaging and relevant to your target audience.
5. **Optimize Your Landing Page**: Make sure your landing page is optimized for conversions with clear CTAs, fast loading times, and mobile optimization.
6. **Target the Right Audience**: Use precise targeting options to reach the most relevant audience for your product or service.
For more detailed guidance on setting up and optimizing tCPA campaigns, you can refer to our guide here: [Introduction to tCPA](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17827591199757-Introduction-to-tCPA).
Should my landing page be like native ads landing page, where we add information like story telling or shopify product page is also perform?

Both types of landing pages can perform well, but it depends on your product and target audience. Here are some considerations for each type:
**Native Ads Landing Page (Storytelling)**:
1. **Engagement**: Storytelling can engage users by creating a narrative around your product, making it more relatable and interesting.
2. **Trust**: Providing detailed information and context can build trust with potential customers.
3. **Conversion Path**: Ensure the story leads to a clear call-to-action (CTA) to guide users towards conversion.
**Shopify Product Page**:
1. **Simplicity**: A straightforward product page with clear images, descriptions, and CTAs can be very effective for users ready to make a purchase.
2. **Focus**: Highlighting the product's features, benefits, and customer reviews can directly address user needs and drive conversions.
3. **Ease of Purchase**: Make sure the purchasing process is simple and seamless to reduce friction.
Ultimately, you may want to test both approaches to see which one resonates more with your audience. For more detailed guidance on creating effective ads and optimizing them, you can refer to our Campaign Set-Up Guide here: [Campaign Set-Up Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/29943576259469-Campaign-Set-Up-Guide).
What websites my ad will show?

NewsBreak is a US-only traffic source, so your ads will be shown to users within the United States. Your ads will appear on the NewsBreak app and website, which is a popular platform for local news and information. This ensures that your ads reach a relevant audience interested in local content.
As affiliate should I use direct advertiser affiliate link and landing page?

As an affiliate, using a direct advertiser's affiliate link and landing page can be effective, but it depends on your strategy and the offer. Here are some pros and cons to consider:
**Using Direct Advertiser Affiliate Link and Landing Page**:
1. **Pros**:
   - **Simplicity**: Easier to set up as you don't need to create your own landing page.
   - **Consistency**: The advertiser's landing page is likely optimized for conversions.
2. **Cons**:
   - **Limited Control**: You have less control over the content and design of the landing page.
   - **Branding**: It may not align perfectly with your brand or marketing style.
**Creating Your Own Landing Page**:
1. **Pros**:
   - **Customization**: Full control over the content, design, and user experience.
   - **Branding**: Can tailor the page to match your brand and marketing strategy.
2. **Cons**:
   - **Effort & Cost**: Requires more effort and potentially additional costs to create and optimize the landing page.
Ultimately, you may want to test both approaches to see which one performs better for your specific audience and offer. For more detailed guidance on creating effective ads and optimizing them, you can refer to our Campaign Set-Up Guide here: [Campaign Set-Up Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/29943576259469-Campaign-Set-Up-Guide).

For keto gummies what audience should I choose?

For keto gummies, you'll want to target an audience that is interested in health, fitness, and weight loss. Here are some specific audience segments you might consider:
1. **Health Enthusiasts**: People who are interested in maintaining a healthy lifestyle and are likely to be interested in dietary supplements.
2. **Fitness Buffs**: Individuals who regularly engage in physical activities and may be looking for products to support their fitness goals.
3. **Weight Loss Seekers**: People actively looking to lose weight or manage their weight, as keto gummies can be an appealing option for them.
4. **Keto Diet Followers**: Those who are already following or interested in the ketogenic diet and would be more inclined to try keto-friendly products.
5. **Age Group**: Typically, adults aged 25-45 who are more health-conscious and willing to invest in dietary supplements.
6. **Gender**: Depending on your product's branding and marketing strategy, you might want to target a specific gender or keep it broad.
For more detailed guidance on targeting the right audience for your campaigns, you can refer to our Campaign Set-Up Guide here: [Campaign Set-Up Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/29943576259469-Campaign-Set-Up-Guide).
Please be more specific, like what audience name is used on your platform for these type of audience?

2. **Fitness Enthusiasts**: Target individuals who regularly engage in physical activities and are likely to be interested in products that support their fitness goals.
3. **Weight Loss Seekers**: People actively looking to lose weight or manage their weight, making them potential customers for keto gummies.
4. **Keto Diet Followers**: Those who are already following or interested in the ketogenic diet and would be more inclined to try keto-friendly products.
5. **Healthy Living**: A broader category that includes individuals interested in various aspects of a healthy lifestyle, including diet and nutrition.
6. **Nutritional Supplements**: Target users who have shown interest in nutritional supplements, vitamins, and similar products.
You can create custom audiences based on these interests or use our predefined audience segments to target your ads effectively. For more detailed guidance on creating and using custom audiences, you can refer to our Audience Management Guide here: [Introduction to Audience Management](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/26679465558669-Introduction-to-Audience-Management).

What ROI I can expect from your ads platform?

The ROI (Return on Investment) you can expect from our ads platform can vary based on several factors, including your targeting, ad creatives, budget, and the specific product or service you are promoting. Here are some key points to consider that can influence your ROI:
1. **Targeting**: Accurate audience targeting is crucial. Make sure you are reaching the right people who are most likely to be interested in your product.
2. **Ad Creatives**: High-quality and engaging ad creatives can significantly impact your ad performance. Invest in visually compelling content that resonates with your audience.
3. **Budget**: Start with a budget that allows you to test and optimize your campaigns. Gradually increase the budget based on performance data.
4. **Optimization**: Regularly review your ad performance and make necessary adjustments to improve results. Use A/B testing to identify which ad variations perform best.
5. **Product/Offer**: The attractiveness of your product or offer also plays a significant role in determining ROI.
While it's challenging to provide a specific ROI figure without knowing the details of your campaign, many advertisers see positive returns by following best practices and continuously optimizing their campaigns.
For more detailed guidance on optimizing your campaigns for better ROI, you can refer to our Campaign Set-Up Guide here: [Campaign Set-Up Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/29943576259469-Campaign-Set-Up-Guide).
What averagly ROI I can expect not exact digits but what ROI is considered as sucessful campaign on your ads platform

A successful ROI on our ads platform can vary depending on the industry, product, and specific goals of the campaign. However, a general benchmark for a successful campaign is achieving an ROI of at least 2:1 or higher. This means that for every dollar spent on advertising, you should aim to generate at least two dollars in revenue. Here are some general guidelines:
1. **2:1 ROI**: Considered a good starting point for many campaigns. It indicates that your campaign is generating twice the revenue compared to the ad spend.
2. **3:1 ROI or Higher**: This is often considered a strong performance and indicates that your campaign is highly effective in generating revenue.
3. **Break-Even Point (1:1 ROI)**: At this point, your ad spend equals your revenue. While not profitable, it can still be valuable for brand awareness and customer acquisition.
4. **Below 1:1 ROI**: If your ROI is below 1:1, it means you are spending more on ads than you are earning in revenue. In this case, optimization and adjustments are necessary to improve performance.
Keep in mind that these benchmarks can vary based on your specific goals and industry standards. Continuously monitoring and optimizing your campaigns will help you achieve better results over time.
For more detailed guidance on optimizing your campaigns for better ROI, you can refer to our Campaign Set-Up Guide here: [Campaign Set-Up Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/29943576259469-Campaign-Set-Up-Guide).
Where can I see audience selection option on your platform?

You can find the audience selection option during the campaign creation process on our platform. Here are the steps to access and select your audience:
1. **Access Ad Management**: Log in to your NewsBreak account and navigate to the Ad Management section.
2. **Create Campaign**: Click on 'Create Campaign' to start setting up a new ad campaign.
3. **Choose Objective**: Select the objective that aligns with your goal, such as brand awareness, website traffic, or app installs. Click 'Save and Next.'
4. **Select Targeting**: In this step, you will be able to build your audience based on various criteria such as location, gender, age, user interest, etc.
5. **Define Audience**: Use the available options to define your target audience more precisely. You can choose from predefined segments or create custom audiences based on specific interests and behaviors.
6. **Save and Continue**: Once you have selected your audience, proceed with defining other campaign settings like budget and schedule.
For more detailed guidance on creating and using custom audiences, you can refer to our Audience Management Guide here: [Introduction to Audience Management](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/26679465558669-Introduction-to-Audience-Management).

6. **Shopping Enthusiasts**: Users who have shown interest in shopping and purchasing various products online.

These interests will help you reach an audience that is more likely to be interested in the Synoshi Power Spin Scrubber and increase your chances of driving sales.
For more detailed guidance on creating and using custom audiences, you can refer to our Audience Management Guide here: [Introduction to Audience Management](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/26679465558669-Introduction-to-Audience-Management).

Do you allow us to advertise cross channel, like I already have conversion recorded in google ads and want to find new conversion over you for the same? Also users who has visited my website already no matter the traffic source I could show my ads on your for those users?

Yes, you can advertise cross-channel and retarget users who have visited your website regardless of the traffic source. Here are the steps to set this up on our platform:
1. **Cross-Channel Advertising**: You can use conversion data from Google Ads to optimize your campaigns on NewsBreak. Ensure that you have proper tracking and attribution set up to measure conversions across different platforms.
2. **Retargeting**: To retarget users who have visited your website, you can use our pixel or postback tracking methods. This allows you to show ads to users who have previously interacted with your site, regardless of how they initially found it.
3. **Setting Up Tracking**: Implement the NewsBreak pixel on your website to track user behavior and conversions. This will help you create custom audiences for retargeting purposes.
4. **Creating Custom Audiences**: Use the data collected from the pixel to create custom audiences based on user interactions with your website. You can then target these audiences with specific ads on NewsBreak.
For detailed guidance on setting up tracking and retargeting, please refer to our documentation here:
- [Introduction to tCPA](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17827591199757-Introduction-to-tCPA)
- [How to integrate a Newsbreak Postback with CPV One](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/34188623183757-How-to-integrate-a-Newsbreak-Postback-with-CPV-One)
If you need further assistance or have specific questions about setting this up, feel free to reach out to our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com.
I am using wecantrack and bemob for tracking purposes, are you able to integrate with them?

Yes, we can integrate with various tracking platforms, including WeCanTrack and BeMob. Here are the steps to integrate these platforms with NewsBreak for tracking purposes:
1. **WeCanTrack Integration**: To integrate WeCanTrack with NewsBreak, you will need to set up postback URLs and ensure that the necessary parameters are being passed correctly. You can find detailed instructions on how to do this in our Help Center.
2. **BeMob Integration**: Similarly, for BeMob, you will need to configure postback URLs and set up the required tracking parameters. Detailed guidance on integrating BeMob with NewsBreak is available in our documentation.
For more detailed guidance on integrating these platforms, please refer to the following articles:
- [How to integrate a Newsbreak Postback with CPV One](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/34188623183757-How-to-integrate-a-Newsbreak-Postback-with-CPV-One)
If you encounter any issues or need further assistance with the integration process, feel free to reach out to our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com.
